Comments_List: I improved my speaking and listening in Japanese

Further grammar, vocabulary and kanji from L3, varying topics of discussion and content questions. I found the Sura Sura content much more interesting and engaging than the JSL content, which made this learning this semester a lot more enjoyable.
Sura sura is really great to facilitate students learning.

I think the format is very good -- I liked the daily quizzes as opposed to less frequent but longer tests, and I enjoyed the discussion of the Sura topics and related culture. I think the homework assignment could be moved around as there were a lot of different assignments on some days, and barely any on other days.
Yes, if you want to learn japanese.
Yes, if you want to learn Japanese. No, if you want a light workload language class.
